Reviews.Title: “Worst courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Christian K
Reviews.Content: I mean what year are we in that the rooms do not have wireless? Especially for a hotel that's meant for business travelers? In addition, the rooms are terrible. I am in a King Suite, but the heater doesn't even work in the bedroom. Not to mention there is no way to turn off the ventilation in the bathroom so it's really loud all the time. Oh and lastly, even the food at the cafe sucks here. I always get a healthy start but this place is the worst. Way overcooked and the bread became as hard as a rock within minutes. And another thing. No other yogurt flavors except vanilla. Really? I can't believe this dump even received 3 starts. And before you doubt my review, I am a gold member for marriott. I am comparing this to other marriotts and this one by far is the worst.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Courtyards for customer service”
Reviews.Author: TCPDump
Reviews.Content: I had business for three weeks in Malvern PA, so I would leave Malvern on Friday afternoon, turn in my car and catch the shuttle to this Courtyard. Yes, there is a Marriott right at the airport, but this Courtyard is quieter than the airport hotel. Before I even arrived I received an E-mail from the manager of the hotel and since I had a question about shuttle bus from the airport I asked..not really expecting any response because you seldom get one, and within a couple hours the managers E-mail told me to contact them as soon as I got to the airport and the shuttle would come right over. The second week the front desk staff greeted me by name, even though I had not identified myself when I requested the shuttle, same for the third week. All the staff were friendly, even at 4:00am in the morning when I had to catch the bus to catch my flight. The Bistro was a nice place to get dinner for the evening, nothing extravagant, but better than going out. The only two issues I have with the site is no wifi in the rooms, but I carry a cable and had no problems with it, and also in the Bistros booths not all the channels worked on the TVs, but since I was not there to watch TV this didn't bother me. I have many more weeks like this coming up and my plans already include a Friday night stay at this Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “No wi-fi? Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: 2ta
Reviews.Content: Typical Courtyard,nice staff and the the new cafe style lobby, which I much prefer to the old breakfast buffet, but come on - no wi-fi? (there is in the lobby but in your room you have plug in a wire! I didn't remember how! too bad, iPaders) Sorry, Marriott, but there is no excuse in the second decade of the 21st century for this.

Reviews.Title: “No wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I've this hotel off of my list when needing a hotel near the airport in Philadelphia. Though it's generally a decent run of the mill Courtyard, it has 2 things going against it IMO. There is no wireless Internet in the rooms and as I travel withan iPad, this creates a problem. This Courtyard also has The Bistro renovation which I dislike as well. As I talk to Courtyard employees across the brand, they all dislike this new lobby just as much as I and many other do, I really wonder why Marriott continues to push this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, expensive food, slow internet”
Reviews.Author: skyserf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times. When we checked in after midnight the staff was friendly. I noticed the lobby looked different from what I remembered. I asked about breakfast which used to be a buffet. Now it's Ã€ la carte and a bit more expensive. There's not really a choice for food unless you have a car here. The internet is pretty slow too. It's advertised as High Speed Internet, it's definitely not that http://www.speedtest.net/result/1681084220.png On another positive note though, the hotel is close to the airport and I-95 but the noise level doesn't seem uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid choice for business travel”
Reviews.Author: BluDevil81
Reviews.Content: Was there for stressful overnight business trip. Very clean room. Very quiet. Excellent lobby with cafe/bar. Staff were helpful and extremely courteous..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pool out of service”
Reviews.Author: rawdeal1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice looking and in a good location but on a a busy weekend they had to shut the pool on Sunday. Maybe they could have fixed the pool at nightime instead of a busy time when there were a lot of kids that wanted to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Staff exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: ElmCityAfficionado
Reviews.Content: Let's start with Michael, the bellman who advised me that taking the SEPTA train during rush hour would get me to the Amtrak station more quickly than a cab and gave me exact instructions about how to get there. At the end of the day, I got on the train and was tapped on the shoulder by none other than Michael the bellman, who happened to be on my train and said he was glad that i made it. He even told me when it was time for me to get off the train and, once at the station, which way to go to get to Amtrak asap. If that's not four-star service, i don't know what is. Also, when i ordered room service, it arrived so quickly that i actually thought they had made a mistake and perhaps that was someone else's meal; no it was mine! I also had a great sleep -- very comfy bed and totally quiet, even though at the airport. Typical Marriott decor (i.e., nothing special.) Only downside was that my colleague found the meeting/catering staff difficult to deal with, partly because they were off-site. Great being attached to the airport -- you can walk across to terminal B.

Reviews.Title: “great room but desk guy was a jerk”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac131
Reviews.Content: my new mother in law got us a room here on our wedding night , when we got to the desk at 3 am with bags in tow still in dress and tux . The guy wouldnt honor her reservation cause she wasnt there. So after explaining to him that the room was paid and should be honored he still wouldnt give it to us. So had to dig for my wallet to pay for the room .149 for the night . Then when we check out the next day the bill states 171 . Which the taxes were never explained to me . So i check my account and now its at 200 dollars for a 20 dollar in case charge they said on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction and this is the best you can do...really!”
Reviews.Author: will2go
Reviews.Content: This is a MCY that is undergoing a major renovation o to install the new MCY bistro. The place was under construction and a real mess. Temp check in was not well thought out. Looked like a storage closet conversion. Date we checked in room key making software was having a big issues and they had to take you to your room and let you in. Supposed to deliver keys that worked later but never received ours. They really could have done a better job if they were planning on staying open during this construction, perhaps a free breakfast or something for all the inconvenience. To get from my room to the temp check in room was a huge maze. Somethings not right here!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0757
Reviews.Content: Checked in around midnight for one night stay in August 2011. Room was freezing cold with air conditioning that would not stop. Staff member came and supposedly "fixed" it. Woke up at 3:30am with room at 87 degrees and hot air pouring out. Another staff member came and said first staff member did not fix it right - duh! Room took well over an hour to cool off because even once AC came on fan would only run on low. All this on top of hotel under construction and staff very pokey. Would never return period.

Reviews.Title: “Quality room- few minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: matchu621
Reviews.Content: During our stay the hotel was undergoing renovations (Aug 2011). I didn't find this disclosed anywhere. The first floor was very noisey, although our room was on the fourth- and we were not disturbed by the construction- i would guess those on the first floor and potentially second floor - weren't so pleased. The area's under construction were what looked to be the main entrance lobby, and cafe (for breakfast). The check-in was pleasant, fast, and the lady at the front desk, Barbra, was extremely nice and a pleasure to work with. We were given the option of floor, chose the 4th (4 floors in this hotel) to get away from the construction. The room was of nice quality, flat screen tv, spacious bathroom, but the room overall seemed just a bit small- designed for two people basically. The free internet was ethernet only- no wireless. The breakfast we paid for was in a room that was cramped. The service during breakfast was mediocre at best. There were two plates left when my girlfriend and I arrived for breakfast, those after us had to wait for new plates to come out in order to serve themselves. There were no clean cups, we had to ask the young lady who was overseeing the service for beverages which she brought out promptly to us and with a smile, but the solution in my eyes would have to bring out clean cups for other guests not just us. The same goes for silverware. Needless to say, the young lady overseeing the breakfast service seemed overwhelmed and inexperienced. But we got our breakfast, ate, enjoyed it and all was well. No 'real' issues. Check out was smooth- and we were on our way. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff and had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: zambonimama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a hockey tournament and it was our first time in Philadelphia. It was a perfect place to stay as a team. We've stayed at many many hotels over the years and we were very impressed with the staff at this hotel. From the front desk, the restaurant, the cleaning staff, to the security guy. Everyone was so friendly and after staying for a week we were pretty comfortable with everyone. They are planning a big renovation in the lobby, even though I thought the lobby looked nice. The hotel was clean and fairly new. The pool and hot tub were nice and it was nice that they were open late. The workout room was fairly small, but the equipment was new and it was never overly busy. They have a washer and dryer that is available for guests, and I was surprised how busy they were. Three times that I tried using them there were people waiting and finally when I got to use them I ended up being very late finishing up my laundry and there was still someone waiting after me. That being the only complaint I'd say the stay was pretty uneventfull and great.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: patois
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the hotel with the caveat that the rooms are very very small. The rooms and the public areas are very well-maintained and the staff couldn't have been nicer. There is a bar and a casual dinner menu available and even though we arrived just after they had closed the kitchen, they stayed late to prepare late night snacks for us. In fact every staff member was friendly and went out of his/her way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but has issues”
Reviews.Author: cavedog117
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful and tried to be helpful. We chose this location partially for the location and things like the pool/spa. Arrived to find the pool/spa were closed for renovations. The staff comp'ed us breakfast after I asked for it as a consolation. We were assigned the 3rd floor, only floor with a suite left. Came back from night activities to find men in respirators walking around renovating the bathrooms. The stench was HORRIFIC. No option given by the staff like a different Marriott to accommodate us, no other suite available in building, didn't have connector or two other rooms available? I can't comfortable recommend the hotel to others - staff was as good as they could be the facility was not. How about staff explain these things on check in and let the guest make their own decision to stay or go elswhere

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Jon96
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine but I was charged double +$50.00 due to hotel error, The managment staff was rude and had to be pushed to make a simple correction. Even then the correction was done wrong, required more phone calls and it wasn't until the bank called that a solution was found

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, just seal all open food”
Reviews.Author: SandiegoChristine52
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until we left, the service was great. We did not want to drive downtown,it was great that SEPTA transportation was right outside. I love the idea, there were always fresh coffee and newspaper available daily. They also provided a microwave oven for our leftovers. My only downfall I noticed, that several ants were on the counter near the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: JJTOH
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at this property. Our king room was adequately clean but quite small; there was no luggage rack and, really, no place really to put a suitcase. The design of the room made its use by two people difficult; if one person were dressing, the other could not walk to or from the bathroom. I had requested a refrigerator. None was in the room when we checked in. I asked at the front desk, and the clerk loudly called someone and commanded him or her to take a refrigerator to the room. It had not shown up by checkout a day and a half later. The bed was confortable, but sleep the first night was marred by lots of noise -- a party of people yelling to/at each other -- at 3 - 4 a.m. Service at breakfast (not included with the room) the next morning was nearly non-existent, despite the restaurant being largely empty. One can order off a limited menu or there is a buffet. The food I ordered, omelet and toast, was not very good, but there is a nice coffee station with coffee and tea available all day. It took a couple of tries to find one of the two treadmills available in the small exercise room, but having individual televisions on the treadmills was a nice surprise in a hotel. Night two also was marred by noisy guests. I used the wired internet service a couple of times, and it worked fine. Overall, the accommodations would probably be fine for me if I were staying alone overnight on business, but otherwise little larger and better designed space would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Cookie Cutter Courtyard. Didn't Disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Publius2003
Reviews.Content: This was a Courtyard that did its best to be like every other Courtyard. Not that that's necessarily a bad thing. I stayed here during extended business in Philly. I booked this for a very reasonable rate after blind bidding on Priceline. Because of this, I was especially happy with my stay. If you are using the airport shuttle, you should note that you ought to call ahead to the hotel when you land, as its shuttles may not be running a regular schedule. I waited a little bit, thinking they ran a regular schedule, before having an attendant at the ground transportation booth call ahead for me. The hotel is located relatively close by. The facility is nearly identical to Courtyards that I stayed at, including Columbus, OH and Savannah, GA. Check in was smooth. The room had contemporary furnishings, and a comfortible bed. My room also contained a fridge. Overall, nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Easy for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: tink326
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before our trip to Disney World. Rooms clean and spacious. A Ruby Tuesday's only one block away - very convenient. Easy access to local parking lots for the airport or free shuttle from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay from Hell”
Reviews.Author: vlamer
Reviews.Content: We checked in and thought we had the perfect hotel. I am a frequent traveler for business and use many of the Marriott hotels. This one started out nicely but ended with my wife and I getting no sleep before flying out. A party was going on across the hall with what looked like unsupervised children and calling the front desk offered no respite from the running up and down the halls and the teenage boys upset at 1AM that there was no party going on. I will never stay in this hotel again and recommend the same for anyone looking for a place near the airport

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you need a place near Airport”
Reviews.Author: MJX
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is pretty Good, typical Marriott Courtyard, Clean neat room. No frills, this one is one of the closest to the Philly Airport, they offer Free Shuttle for pick up & Drop. At the lobby you can enjoy good French vanilla Coffee, use their business centre. If you want to go to the City then book some hotel in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - few minuses!”
Reviews.Author: JoeMary01
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 15th. Khalil at front desk very helpful, courteous. Dined at Trophies Lounge. Good value for the money. Food was tasty. Not much atmosphere when we were there; one large group by itself and 2 solo drinkers. Rooms were very nice; bed very comfortable. No noise from adjacent room or hallways. Based on past reviews I had asked to be away from the center atrium. Definitely away from things; you have to travel about 20 minutes to get anyswhere. Hard to reach, even with Mapquest but worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, a little banged up, could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: cruisermeg
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott points for a last minute stay here as I decided to go to a Phillies game. We arrived about 2PM or so and were promptly and pleasantly checked in. I was recognized with my Marriott status, which for this year, I think is only the 2nd time. Got an accessible room with 2 beds as requested. The room was fine and served it's purpose. It wasn't filthy-just little detail things such as a shoe print on the wall, finger prints on the glass over the pictures, and make-up finger prints on the bathroom door. Not gross, but still not nice. I wiped everything with Lysol wipes as usual. Didn't eat in the htotel this time-instead drove about 1-2 miles to a Subway for sandwiches. The A/C actually worked and wasn't overly noisy. TV reception was good, but the game wasn't on so mom couldn't look for me! TVs are NOT HD-not even the newer, big flat screens. Internet (wired only in rooms) is free, but NOT super fast. I had been granted a late checkout by the Operations manager shortly after check in...but no one told the AM crew (and the gal was rather rude until she noticed my status), no one told housekeeping so they knocked on the door, and I specifically asked to get my key extended but it stopped working. That entire situation was very annoying..... The hotel has a 24 hour shuttle and is close to a Ruby Tuesday, as well as offering nightly dinner service (or room service). I asked for a fridge, had to call again, but it did show up. The hotel was quiet-only heard some plane noise and virtually nothing from the hall or the connecting room. (For some reason, most accessible rooms in Marriotts are connecting..) There is security at night, free parking and overall seems to be fairly safe. I would consider staying again, provided they clean up and the few staffers who were NOT nice get their acts together. Fairly easy access to I-95 and there are several other hotels nearby. All in all, if you just want to lay your head someplace, the CY is fine.....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for my purpose”
Reviews.Author: jas7437
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I needed to make an early morning flight, and didn't want to be scurrying to the airport during morning traffic. Boy was I impressed! I turned in my rental car just outside the hotel and walked across a parking lot to check in. The hotel room was very clean, and they supplied the extra pillows (sans down) that I requested when making my reservation. Even though my room was right across from the employee stairwell, it was very quiet. The only time I was aware of planes taking off just above me was when I realized that there was a very slight rumble. Complaints - when checking in, there was a significant line of guests waiting, while there was only one employee checking us in. Breakfast was ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Below average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: spjwstaines
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of Marriott Courtyard Hotels on our annual Summer holidays to the US. We have found that their standard varies quite a lot. Some are excellent whilst others are very poor; unfortunately, this hotel fell into the latter category. We landed at PHL and needed a bed for a night, a pool for the children to unwind in and somewhere to eat. We found that the hotel room was adequate, although it looked tired and we did not have the pillows on our beds thta we pre-ordered on their website. The pool was small, which we knew, but it was being used by a large number of unsupervised and very noisey children. The hotel staff appologised for this but it still ruined our stay after an 8 hour flight. The food in the resataurant was poor, although it was not expensive and the staff were friendly. The restaurant was dirty. Overall a below average stay especially so given that we paid $190 for the experience. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good way to end a holiday”
Reviews.Author: gwhyte
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at this hotel based on (mainly)positive reviews on this website. More expensive than other hotels in the area, but my family were at the end of a road trip and wanted to dump the rental car and have 24 hours lazing in the room and by the pool. Shuttle from hotel was fine, but be careful about getting a pick up form the airport - they tell you to go to zone 4, but EVERY terminal has a zone 4, so make sure you specify exactly which terminal you are at. Room was big and comfy. A/C was efficient and very quiet, blackout curtains allowed us a very welcome lie in. Tried to have evening meal in the Courtyard Cafe in the lobby. Waited 15 mins to get order taken, then 40 mins for meal and when it arrived it was wrong. The waitress complained that they were busy with room service too, but would not eat there again in a hurry, especially as Ruby Tuesdays a block down the road does such WONDERFUL food. Other posters have made comment about its busyness - just try to eat at off-peak times. It is well worth the trip. Pool and jacuzzi were clean and welcome part of the stay - courtyard area outside too for drying off in the sun. Our flight did not leave PHL until 9pm, so we arranged to stay in the room until 5pm for an extra $99. Was quite a lot (for us) but defintely worth it to avoid hanging around the airport. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Freshly baked cookies on the reception counter during the day were an added bonus. Would definitely return here if the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard as you expect it”
Reviews.Author: Luusmeitli
Reviews.Content: The rooms were similar to other Courtyards. The TV was not easy to see from the bed. The shuttle brings you to a train which goes downtown. The hotel has free parking and is only about 10-15 minutes at most from downtown. We stayed here in part to avoid the high overnight parking costs of the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad thing to say”
Reviews.Author: broooce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend in October while attending 2 concerts at the nearby Wachovia Center. Check in was smooth and speedy, staff appeared friendly from the start. Lobby was clean and spacious, our room was 404 and easy to find. Room was clean and had a private balcony, there were four of us 2 adults and 2 children so would have been nice to have 2 beds but the sofabed did the job. Standard facilities included and the internet access worked without any problems. Our rate included breakfast which was great, plenty of choice including cooking eggs to my liking, staff in the breakfast area were suberb nothing too much trouble. Although there were meals available in the evening we decided to eat at the nearby Ruby Tuesdays which was excellent both times. The pool area was clean and a real plus with kids, the gym was small but seemed to be well equipped. The location of the hotel in proximty to the Wachovia Complex was excellent just a short 10 minute drive. One day we went into Philly and the airport shuttle dropped us off at the nearby train station and picked us up later in the day when we called them, drivers were friendly and knowledgeable. Overall this hotel was excellent and I would recommend it with no hesitation, I would stay here again and am probably converted to the Marriott brand as well. A stand out hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: FoodWallah
Reviews.Content: I'm at the end of a five-day stay at the Courtyard Marriott Phila. Airport. Hotels in Philly commonly have lots of problems -- high prices, poor service, bad maintenance, lousy management -- so this hotel was a BIG surprise. There was a lot of thought put into the refurbishment that was done a year or so ago, and it was implemented well. And as a previous poster noted, the building is very solid. I never heard a sound from another room. The carpeting, linens, furniture and toiletries are a cut above what one would expect, as is the free breakfast: Not only is there an ample buffet, but they'll cook to order an omelet or other hot dishes at no cost! And unusual for Philly (the "City of Brotherly Shove"), I found all the employees to be pleasant and relatively competent; no "attitude" here. Other small but nice touches include an excellent desk/work area (with free high-speed Internet); excellent lighting throughout the room; and a curved rod for the shower curtain, which gives the feeling of much more space in the shower. There are a small, unimpressive "fitness center" and a small swimming pool; both are clean and offer nice thick towels. Minor minuses: I'd have liked a "central" heating/cooling system; my room had one that was built into the wall. It worked fine but created a draft when I was working at the desk. Also, a refrigerator would have been welcome. Some might disagree, but I found the location and layout to be an advantage: It's in an industrial area very close to the airport, there's free parking, and easy access to both of Philly's major freeways. (I-76 and I-95). It's a 15-minute drive to the sports stadiums and to a wide selection of excellent restaurants in South Philly or in suburban communities like Media. This hotel deserves to be solidly in the three-star category. I gave it a five rating both because of the factors I described above and because of the weak competition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljk73
Reviews.Content: We went to Philly for a long weekend to celebrate a birthday. Many of the downtown hotels were full and the ones that weren't were ridiculously expensive. Having never been to Philly before, we were worried about finding our way to downtown from an airport hotel. Happily, it all worked out very well. Although there is no shopping or restaurants readily close by, it was an easy drive to downtown. We found out upon arrival that the hotel was undergoing some renovation. At first I was disappointed, but that quickly went away. Our room was very nice, completely renovated and it seemed as if we were the first ones to use it! The renovation was continuing in the hallway outside our room and all of the ceiling tiles were taken out, exposing the wiring and pipes above. However, the workers conducted their job as absolutely subtly as possible. In fact, we never heard a thing. They totally cleaned up everything each day so that you couldn't tell they had even been there. Congrats to Marriott for really making the renovation a non-issue. Our check-in went smoothly except for a glitch with our room key which did not work. We had a nice courtyard view and did not notice the airport traffic at all. This is an older hotel that was obviously built back when they built them properly. The walls and floors are very solid and thick. We never heard a peep of noise from anywhere. The beds and linens were great. The room stayed at the perfect temperature with a very quiet thermostat. But the highlight of the stay was the shower head. My goodness, that thing was awesome. Wanted to bring it home with us. Our checkout was smooth, billing, rates, and coupons were all correct. One of the front desk staff gave us a great tip and directions for a breakfast stop. We would recommend this hotel not only for airport travelers, but visitors to Philly as well. It's really not that hard to get to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: lv2travel_73
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, clean and confortable rooms, great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are going to Philadelphia just for the airport...”
Reviews.Author: dcam07
Reviews.Content: We booked the Courtyard at the last minute for a trip to Philadelphia to see a Phillies game, and while the hotel was a fine place to stay if you were waiting for a flight at the airport, I would not reccommend it for any other type of trip simply due to its location (expect to pay $20+ per person for a taxi trip to Center City or Manayunk!). When we arrived at the hotel we checked in quickly, but found that we were missing a cot we had requested in the room. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous, and took care of the problem right away. There is a TGIFriday's right in the parking lot, which would be very convenient for travelers. The hotel was clean and the breakfast in the morning was sufficient. I would recommend not staying on the first floor if you want a quieter stay, since the pool seemed to be filled with kids until a rather late hour.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Relaxation Time”
Reviews.Author: BygGyrlzRSexy2
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Courtyard. I stayed for the weekend of New Years. The room looked clean, but I found a used wash rag under the bed. When I complained to management they apologized, and took money off of my bill. My daughter needed a screwdriver to install batteries into one of her games, and we phoned the front desk and someone gave us a screwdriver in less than 10 minutes. The staff was very friendly. The only down side to our stay was the dining area and room service is not available on weekends, so we asked for menus and the front desk staff gave us plenty. I will visit the Courtyard again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: gari417
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very freshly renovated so our room was beautiful and cozy. The hotel staff is pretty friendly and their shuttle service will take you to the airport and the nearby train stop, which we utilized many times. There is nothing exciting in walking distance, but the train will take you downtown in about 15 minutes and costs a few dollars each way. We went downtown every day to shop and eat at fabulous restaurants. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel located away from the downtown life, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: desilibrarian
Reviews.Content: We were stuck at this airport-area hotel because we booked too late to find one in Center City; we needed to commute daily to the Convention Center (8 miles away). Luckily, a staff member suggested taking the free hotel shuttle to the Eastwick station, then hopping on a SEPTA train which dropped us off inside the Convention Center. Perfect! And the $3.75 train fare beats the $30 cab ride. Every employee that I met at the Courtyard Airport was very friendly, relaxed, and helpful: front desk staff, shuttle drivers, and food servers. I wanted to do laundry one evening, and the staff member could not locate the free soap--so she drove to another hotel to pick up a box for me! All service was provided with a smile. The bed was wonderful, too--I slept great!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As far as Courtyards go, I expected a bit more, especially for a Marriott propery. The room was a good size and there was free internet. The internet did take about 5 minutes to detect my connection, which caused me some concern at first,, but was fine after that. The king-sized bed was confortable, although the comfortor-like piece on the bed made no sense--it looked like a table runner. The bathroom wasn't spotless when I came in. Not that my standards are THAT high, but I expect there not to be any hairs on the floor. There is only shampoo and soap offered--no conditioner, no lotion. The breakfast was okay (eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, pastries, cereal, yogurt), but for the price, there should be more offerings (juice & coffee are not included in the price of the buffet). The staff were friendly and I had no trouble with parking. It was an average stay and I wouldn't be opposed to staying there again if I couldn't find a better deal in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware of Shuttle and Restaurant Times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are choosing this hotel because of its amenities, please be aware that its shuttle DOES NOT run 24 hours per day. It begins at 5AM and runs every 45 minutes thereafter. Also, its restaurant is only open on weekdays. I chose this hotel via the internet for these 2 amenities and was sorely disappointed. I arrived on a Saturday night. All I wanted was to grab something to eat, soak in the hottub, get a good nights rest, then make it back to the airport for my early morning flight. Upon arrival I learned the restaurant was closed on weekends and the shuttle began at 5AM. I specifically asked how often it ran and was told "All day". I walked to a restaurant for dinner, then changed for a soak in the hottub...it was broken. Now if the broken hottub was the only thing that was wrong with this hotel, it would have been fine, but with everything else it just added to my disappointment. The next morning I arrived in the lobby at 5:10AM and was told the shuttle had just left. "No problem" I thought, "I'll just catch it when it gets back, right?"...WRONG! I was then informed that it ran every 45 minutes. Why the staff didn't tell me that when I asked the night before I'll never know. So, overall the hotel was average. The room was OK, and if their website and staff would have been more forthcoming with shuttle times and restaurant hours, I would have given them a better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: swpswp
Reviews.Content: Decent alternative to staying in downtown Philadelphia, even for tourists. Saves a bit of money and parking is free. It is about a 15-minute drive into the city, and day parking on weekends is cheap, and in some cases free. It is certainly less than parking at downtown hotel lots. As for the hotel, the room was clean with few mystery stains. No hair conditioner though, which was surprising. Some newer hotels offer rooms with two queen beds, and this only had two doubles. Free Internet is nice and the buffet breakfast is not a bad deal either. Service was good too. We found the pool area clean. Nobody checks in there, so if people are not following the rules - as another reviewer noted - you'd have to go to the front desk. Hot tub was just very warm, and pool was refreshing instead of the normal disgusting sauna-like conditions at most indoor hotel pools.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriot”
Reviews.Author: waswild
Reviews.Content: Recently met up with my husband for a "mini-break" at the Courtyard by Marriot Philadelphia Airport. Pros -- 1. Friendly, efficient check-in. Had to sign "no party" agreement -- fine by me! Guests at hotel are not to have more than 5 people in their rooms. 2. Comfortable lobby with WiFi and good, free coffee & tea. 3. Breakfast buffet was very nice and cost $8.95. 4. Clean, nicely decorated room. 5. Very comfortable bed. We stayed in "King Room", which also has a pull-out double-sized sofa bed. 6. Abundance of non-smoking rooms. 7. Very close to airport. Terminal is on east side of I-95 and hotel is on west side of I-95. Free airport shuttle. 8. Except for lobby door, all other entrances to property require room key. Pool and workout area both require room key, as well. 9. Large desk in room. 10. Take-out from local restaurant can be delivered to hotel and charged to room. 11. Nice choice of in-room movies. Used pay-per-view to watch a movie that hadn't yet been released on DVD or premium tv. 12. No problems with water pressure or temperature. 13. Free high-speed internet access in rooms. (If you want WiFi, just go to lobby.) 14. Quiet rooms! Average -- 1. Exercise room could stand to have updated cardio equipment. Three treadmills, exercise bike and stair stepper not exactly latest equipment. Cons -- 1. Parking lot is not fenced in. Signs all over that you park at your own risk. This area of Phila is very peaceful, but still...keep your vehicle locked and watch yourself at night. 2. No "park and fly" packages. Probably because hotel parking lot is not fenced in. (Hint: Airport parking lot is sometimes very crowded with long walk to shuttle stops and even longer wait for shuttle. There are private lots nearby where you drop your car at the office and hop right on a shuttle. Priced the same or cheaper than airport lot.) 3. What is it with the temperature of indoor pools at hotels lately? I guess they save money by keeping the temperature low, but we couldn't swim. It was just too cold! 4. Large hot tub was the temperature the pool should have been -- which is too cold for a hot tub. 5. Hotel policy is that children are not to be in the pool are at all after 9 PM. Hotel policy is also that children under 16 must be accompanied by parent at all times in pool area. Hotel did not enforce policy. We could not stay in pool area due to ten youngsters in a group that were apparently dumped in the pool area one evening instead of staying with a babysitter. They tended to follow us everywhere we went and used the hot tub as a pool - splashing and yelling all the time. We asked them to stop splashing and bumping into us (little boys hurt when they keep plowing into you at full force!), but they got worse. Decided to leavy anyway, due to temperature of water and lack of chemicals in hot tub. (It was "slimey".) We actually picked this hotel for the indoor pool and hot tub. VERY DISAPPOINTED!! They have such a nice pool area...they really should take care of the water chemicals, temperature and enforce their "children" policy. 6. Along same lines -- hotel is supposed to stock towels in pool area. The children seemed to have beaten us to them and they had them scattered everywhere. 7. Restaurant (except for breakfast) and room service only available Monday through Friday. Still giving hotel above average rating due to overall facility and good staff, but they really should work on the pool situation. If you don't go to the pool (which I admit most people don't), this hotel is just fine. I've read reviews of unclean hotels by the airport, but the Courtyard is clean and well-cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: nfahey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard on July 19, 2003 after a late flight into the Philadelphia Airport. We booked the room through priceline and got a great deal on the room.The front desk was very polite and fast b/c she knew we were tired and wanted to get to bed as it was 2:30 in the morning.We had just returned from Aruba and had a horrible bed all week at our resort. I don't know if this played a role in my opinion of the Courtyard beds, but this was one of the most comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on. It was one of those memory foam mattresses and wow did both my husband and I feel good in the morning!I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Philadelphia Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 8900 Bartram Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19153
